==Events==
* [[844]] &ndash; [[Battle of Clavijo]]: The [[Apostle]] [[James, son of Zebedee|Saint James the Greater]] is said to have miraculously appeared to a force of outnumbered [[Kingdom of Asturias|Asturians]] and aided them against the forces of the [[Emirate of Córdoba|Emir of Cordoba]].
*[[1430]] &ndash; [[Siege of Compiègne]]: [[Joan of Arc]] is captured by the [[Duchy of Burgundy|Burgundians]] while leading an army to relieve [[Compiègne]].
*[[1498]] &ndash; [[Girolamo Savonarola]] is burned at the stake in [[Florence]], [[Italy]].
*[[1533]] &ndash; The marriage of [[List of English monarchs#House of Tudor|King]] [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] to [[Catherine of Aragon]] is declared null and void.
*[[1568]] &ndash; The [[Netherlands]] declare their [[independence]] from [[Spain]].
*  1568   &ndash; Dutch rebels led by [[Louis of Nassau]], defeat [[Jean de Ligne, Duke of Arenberg]], and his loyalist troops in the [[Battle of Heiligerlee (1568)|Battle of Heiligerlee]], opening the [[Eighty Years' War]].
*[[1609]] &ndash; Official ratification of the Second Charter of [[Virginia]] takes place.
*[[1618]] &ndash; The [[Defenestrations of Prague|Second Defenestration of Prague]] precipitates the [[Thirty Years' War]].
*[[1701]] &ndash; After being convicted of [[piracy]] and of murdering William Moore, Captain [[William Kidd]] is hanged in [[London]], [[England]].
*[[1706]] &ndash; [[Battle of Ramillies]]: [[John Churchill, 1st Duke of Marlborough]], defeats a [[France|French]] army under [[Marshal of France|Marshal]] [[François de Neufville, duc de Villeroi]].
*[[1788]] &ndash; [[South Carolina]] ratifies the [[United States Constitution]] as the 8th [[United States|American]] state.
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[Battle of Famars]] during the [[Flanders Campaign]] of the [[War of the First Coalition]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; [[Accordion]] patent granted to [[Cyrill Demian]] in [[Vienna]], [[Austrian Empire]].
*[[1844]] &ndash; Declaration of the [[Báb]]: a merchant of Shiraz announces that he is a Prophet and founds a religious movement that would later be brutally crushed by the Persian government. He is considered to be a forerunner of the [[Bahá'í Faith]], and Bahá'ís celebrate the day as a holy day.
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: President [[Mariano Paredes]] of [[Mexico]] unofficially declares war on the United States.
*[[1873]] &ndash; The [[Canada|Canadian]] Parliament establishes the [[North-West Mounted Police]], the forerunner of the [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: Sergeant [[William Harvey Carney]] is awarded the [[Medal of Honor]] for his heroism in the [[Assault on the Battery Wagner]] in 1863.
*[[1907]] &ndash; The [[Unicameralism|unicameral]] [[Parliament of Finland]] gathers for its first plenary session.
*[[1911]] &ndash; The [[New York Public Library]] is dedicated.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: Italy joins the [[Allies of World War I|Allies]] after they declare war on [[Austria-Hungary]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; In [[Brazil]], four students are shot and killed during a manifestation against the Brazilian dictator [[Getúlio Vargas]], which occurred in the city of [[São Paulo]]. Their names and surnames were used to form the [[MMDC]], a revolutionary group that would act against the dictatorial government, especially in the [[Constitutionalist Revolution]] ("Revolução Constitucionalista", in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]), the major uprising in Brazil during the [[20th century]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; The American [[Bank robbery|bank robbers]] [[Bonnie and Clyde]] are ambushed by police and killed in [[Black Lake, Louisiana]].
*  1934   &ndash; The [[Auto-Lite strike]] culminates in the "Battle of Toledo", a five-day melée between 1,300 troops of the [[Ohio National Guard]] and 6,000 picketers.
*[[1939]] &ndash; The [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] [[submarine]] [[USS Sailfish (SS-192)|USS ''Squalus'']] sinks off the coast of [[New Hampshire]] during a test dive, causing the death of 24 sailors and two civilian technicians. The remaining 32 sailors and one civilian naval architect are rescued the following day.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Heinrich Himmler]], the head of the [[Schutzstaffel]], commits [[suicide]] while in [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] custody.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The [[Flensburg Government]] under [[President of Germany (1919–1945)|Reichspräsident]] [[Karl Dönitz]] is dissolved when its members are captured and arrested by [[United Kingdom|British]] forces at [[Flensburg]] in Northern [[Germany]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Thomas C. Wasson]], the US Consul-General, is assassinated in [[Jerusalem]], [[Israel]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[West Germany|Federal Republic of Germany]] is established and the [[Basic Law for the Federal Republic of Germany]] is proclaimed.
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Tibet]]ans sign the [[Seventeen Point Agreement for the Peaceful Liberation of Tibet]] with [[China]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The satellite ''[[Explorer 1]]'' ceases transmission.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Egypt]] closes the [[Straits of Tiran]] and blockades the port of [[Eilat]] at the northern end of the [[Gulf of Aqaba]] to Israeli shipping.
*[[1992]] &ndash; Italy's most prominent anti-mafia judge [[Giovanni Falcone]], his wife and three body guards are killed by the [[Corleonesi]] clan with a half-ton bomb near [[Capaci]], [[Sicily]]. His friend and colleague [[Paolo Borsellino]] will be assassinated less than 2 months later, making 1992 a turning point in the history of [[Sicilian Mafia|Italian Mafia]] prosecutions.
*[[1995]] &ndash; The first version of the [[Java (programming language)|Java programming language]] is released.
*[[1998]] &ndash; The [[Good Friday Agreement]] is accepted in a [[referendum]] in [[Northern Ireland]] with 75% voting yes.
*[[2002]] &ndash; The "55 parties" clause of the [[Kyoto Protocol]] is reached after its ratification by [[Iceland]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; Part of Paris [[Charles de Gaulle Airport]]'s Terminal 2E collapses, killing four people and injuring three others.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Alaska]]n [[stratovolcano]] [[Mount Cleveland (Alaska)|Mount Cleveland]] erupts.
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[International Court of Justice]] (ICJ) awards [[Middle Rocks]] to [[Malaysia]] and [[Pedra Branca, Singapore|Pedra Branca]] (Pulau Batu Puteh) to [[Singapore]], ending a 29-year [[Pedra Branca dispute|territorial dispute]] between the two countries.
*[[2009]] &ndash; Former [[President_of_South_Korea|South Korean president]] [[Roh Moo-hyun]] commits suicide, jumping from a 45 meter cliff in [[Bongha]], [[Gimhae]], [[South Korea]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Jamaica]]n police begin a manhunt for drug lord [[Christopher Coke]], after the United States requested his extradition, leading to [[2010 Kingston unrest|three days of violence]] during which at least 73 bystanders are killed.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Adam Lambert]] became the first [[openly gay]] artist to debut at #1 on the [[Billboard 200]] Album Charts, with his album ''[[Trespassing (album)|Trespassing]]''.
*[[2013]] &ndash; The [[Interstate 5]] bridge over the [[Skagit River]] [[I-5 Skagit River Bridge collapse|collapses]] in [[Mount Vernon, Washington]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; 7 people (including the perpetrator) are killed and 13 injured in a [[2014 Isla Vista massacre|series of drive-by shootings]] near the campus of [[University of California, Santa Barbara]].
